alert.note: Alert for Knox; Laurel; McCreary; Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 9:30PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Laurel, west central Knox, northeastern McCreary and northwestern Whitley Counties through 1000 PM EDT... At 930 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cumberland Falls S.P., or 10 miles northeast of Whitley City, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Krupp around 935 PM EDT. Youngs Creek around 940 PM EDT. Deering, Walden, Bark Camp, Clio and Goldbug around 945 PM EDT. Rye, Grove, Rockholds and Holly Bay Rec. Area around 950 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Barton, Faber, Vox, Moore Hill, Woodbine, North Corbin, Wilton and Keavy. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
